body:
Comment 2: 
OK. I'm setting GOTRACEBACK. I'll post a traceback when I get a chance.

I can't comment on what happens when the process stops looping, since it doesn't stop
(till it's killed). The ktrace dump from a few seconds of this loop is 5.5 million lines
exactly like the ones I posted.

My wild guess as to the cause would be some subtle difference in behavior between
FreeBSD's umtx and Linux's futex that could be hit by the new scheduler.
